alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 6:12AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Broome. In northeast Pennsylvania, Susquehanna. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated persistent steady rain. The threat for minor flooding exists in the advisory area due to 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain that fell earlier this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected through 8 AM this morning over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deposit, Sanford, Susquehanna, Susquehanna Depot, Hallstead, Windsor, New Milford, Great Bend, Lanesboro, Hickory Grove, Lakeview and Lakeside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
